newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rates mostly lower on speculation.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rates mostly lower on speculation.

text.p: Mexican Cetes rates moved generally lower on the secondary money market MXAAB near midday on Friday, mostly on speculation, dealers said.
The same-day Cetes rate fell 80 basis points to 23.20 percent while 28-day Cetes rates declined 100 basis points to 23 percent and six-month rates dropped 50 basis points lower to 28.50 percent.
But 91-day rates rose 100 basis points to 27.50 percent.
"It looks pretty solid at these levels although some people still want to push rates down some more. That's why rates hit 23 percent so early," one dealer said.
Rates on bank notes and acceptances were flat at 24.50 percent.
